questions.question_text: Which statement is correct about the VMware Cloud Foundation upgrade process?

choices.A: Management Domain must be upgraded first before any Workload Domain
choices.D: Hosted workloads must be shut down as the upgrade process requires hosts reboots.
choices.C: Upgrade bundles must be manually downloaded and uploaded to vCenter Server.
choices.B: The ESXi hosts must be upgraded using VMware generic ESXi image; customized OEM images can't be used

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
SDDC GUI and Developer Centrer are the options

questions.question_text:
The administrator for a new VMware Cloud Foundation instance for an organization needs to automate the deployment of an NSX-T Edge Cluster for the workload domain that will be stored in the SDDC Manager inventory.
Which two options may the administrator use? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
for host deployment in sddc

choices.A: Making a cluster image available in VMware Cloud Foundation
choices.B: Uploading ISO and VIB files to the VMware Imaging Appliance service
choices.D: Sizing compute and storage resources for VMware Cloud Foundation with Tanzu
choices.C: Configuring the Management Network and the VM Network port groups with the same VLAN ID

questions.question_text:
An administrator has imaged the servers with ESXi and VIBs and must now perform some post-imaging tasks.
What is the most common task that needs to be completed after the bring-up process?

discussion.content: B is incorrect, all NSX edge configurations (logical routers and edge services gateways) are backed up as part of the NSX Manager data backup.

Selected Answer: AE
A and E should be correct.

Ref. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-Foundation/4.2/vcf-admin/GUID-A28F229C-D96D-43E5-A7AF-5D3CBF2A84AD.html

choices.B: Only NSX Manager VMs are backed up.
choices.C: A separate external backup server must be registered for each NSX Manager instance.
choices.D: The file transfer protocol used for NSX backups is insecure, so the administrator must create a secure network tunnel for backup traffic.
choices.A: The backup server configuration can be edited to change the backup location, but previous backups must be manually copied from the old location to the new location.
choices.E: Only a user with the ADMIN role can configure the NSX backup server details in SDDC Manager.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding VMware NSX Manager backup configuration in VMware SDDC Manager? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
its d 
Note that the tool will NOT change the password of the SDDC Manager. This needs to be done manually. Also, to rotate passwords on VCF the user logged in must have the Admin-privileges.
D, local admin is used for password rotation
D is the answer that the Admin role can only perform this task

questions.question_text: Which VMware SDDC Manager user account can be configured to use password rotation?
